## Public Member Functions

### assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#a3b9c6a6d8deeb4b38fe15c4bbfcfaced}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool M68kFrameLowering::assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI, std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; &amp; CSI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Allows target to override spill slot assignment logic.

If implemented, <a href="#a3b9c6a6d8deeb4b38fe15c4bbfcfaced">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> should assign frame slots to all CSI entries and return true. If this method returns false, spill slots will be assigned using generic implementation. <a href="#a3b9c6a6d8deeb4b38fe15c4bbfcfaced">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> may add, delete or rearrange elements of CSI.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00103">103</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00801">801</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canSimplifyCallFramePseudos() {#adc502ecbdb24c972db2f4f46048b869e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool M68kFrameLowering::canSimplifyCallFramePseudos (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
If there is a reserved call frame, the call frame pseudos can be simplified.

Having a FP, as in the default implementation, is not sufficient here since we can&#39;t always use it. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> a more nuanced condition.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00135">135</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00060">60</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a16d9aef1065a0997fe2ac4b560ca9cce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void M68kFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00094">94</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00771">771</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#a9a9a690dd5678ad91fe6622af79116fd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator M68kFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00078">78</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00229">229</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getFrameIndexReference() {#a7a7d0ca18a51d0d4829fb467deed15e9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StackOffset M68kFrameLowering::getFrameIndexReference (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, int FI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; FrameReg) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method should return the base register and offset used to reference a frame index location.

The offset is returned directly, and the base register is returned via FrameReg.

### hasReservedCallFrame() {#a3e5e130e3af325c9671f8d20ce8fa7ad}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool M68kFrameLowering::hasReservedCallFrame (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Under normal circumstances, when a frame pointer is not required, we reserve argument space for call sites in the function immediately on entry to the current function.

This eliminates the need for add/sub sp brackets around call sites. Returns true if the call frame is included as part of the stack frame.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00129">129</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### mergeSPUpdates() {#a6fb1f0f989a0f31e3841b663135a4f27}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int M68kFrameLowering::mergeSPUpdates (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> &amp; MBBI, bool doMergeWithPrevious) const</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> the instruction before/after the passed instruction.

If it is an ADD/SUB/LEA instruction it is deleted argument and the stack adjustment is returned as a positive value for ADD/LEA and a negative for SUB.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00156">156</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00384">384</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.

### restoreCalleeSavedRegisters() {#ab5fe151eb7f6fa13e78ed30cb5f1ad72}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool M68kFrameLowering::restoreCalleeSavedRegisters (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; CSI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

Returns false otherwise.

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Issues instruction(s) to spill all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of store instructions via storeRegToStackSlot().

Returns false otherwise.

## Protected Member Functions

### hasFPImpl() {#a0467fb31b542da4b9672b69ae002cf97}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool M68kFrameLowering::hasFPImpl (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["protected", "virtual"]}>
Return true if the specified function should have a dedicated frame pointer register.

This is true if the function has variable sized allocas, if it needs dynamic stack realignment, if frame pointer elimination is disabled, or if the frame address is taken.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h/#l00169">169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-h">M68kFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp/#l00045">45</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/m68k/m68kframelowering-cpp">M68kFrameLowering.cpp</a>.

### calculateMaxStackAlign() {#a88c6739de09a1820410bb804c16914be}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t M68kFrameLowering::calculateMaxStackAlign (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}>
If we&#39;re forcing a stack realignment we can&#39;t rely on just the frame info, we need to know the ABI stack alignment as well in case we have a call out.

Otherwise just make sure we have some alignment - we&#39;ll go with the minimum SlotSize.
